title: Interim Criteria - Building Permit Application Routing to City Agencies
summary: THE routing table for SF building permits. Maps scope of work categories to reviewing agencies (Planning, BLDG, MECH, SFFD, BSM, PUC, Health, OCII, PW-DAC). Contains 26-page Attachment 1 matrix plus discussion rules A-N covering special routing conditions.

agencies.PLANNING: Planning Department (City Planning - Zoning Counter, CP-ZOC)
agencies.BLDG: DBI Architectural and Structural Plan Review
agencies.MECH/MECH-E: DBI Mechanical Plan Review / Electrical Plan Review
agencies.BSM: DPW Bureau of Street-Use and Mapping
agencies.OCII: Office of Community Investment and Infrastructure (successor to SF Redevelopment Agency)
agencies.PW-DAC: DPW Office of Disability Access Coordinator

discussion_rules.text: This Information Sheet supersedes all previously issued documentation on routing.
discussion_rules.action: Use this document as the authoritative routing reference

discussion_rules.text: Building permit applications, renewals of expired permits, and permit revisions that fall under the categories listed in Attachment 1 shall be referred by DBI to the specified agencies for review.
Routing to Department of Public Health (DPH)
conditions: New construction, seismic retrofit or remodel of buildings under DPH programs
Onsite consumption in Medical Cannabis Dispensing facilities (route DPH first before Planning)
exceptions: Do not route Article 38 (enhanced ventilation) construction plans to DPH

discussion_rules.text: Routing to Planning and Others (for site permit and addendum)
discussion_rules.action: Planning is first station for site permit
conditions: New buildings: architectural addendum routes to Planning, BSM, PUC (even if no changes from site permit). Planning is LAST station for architectural addendum.
Existing buildings: architectural addendum need not route to Planning if no changes from site permit (unless specifically requested)

discussion_rules.text: In OCII areas, permits route to OCII instead of Planning. OCII is last station to review.
discussion_rules.action: Route to OCII instead of Planning

discussion_rules.text: Major changes on issued Site Permit
discussion_rules.action: File new permit application form 3/8 as altered site permit
steps: Route to Planning for review/approval (with reference drawings)
Original site permit remains active, paired with altered site permit
No altered site permit if addendum already issued
All addenda under altered site permit
Fees based on both altered and original site permit

discussion_rules.text: Routing to Fire for buildings of R3 occupancy
conditions: All site permit plans of new buildings → SFFD for access and Fire-flow analysis
Sprinkler addendum → SFFD (other addendum not required)
Additions/alterations: applicant marks sprinkler status on plans
Vertical additions → SFFD for Fire Department access

discussion_rules.text: Coordination with Department of Environment on demolition

conditions: Site permit and architectural addendum for new construction, alteration, addition, change in occupancy/use
On any City Project or project receiving public funds
discussion_rules.note: See Information Sheet DA-02 pages 2-3 for City Projects

not_required_when: Element affixed to building is no more than 4 inches into Public Way
Minor element authorized by previous permit (utility fixtures, water spouts, standpipes, outward-swinging doors, security gates)
Permit exclusively for accessibility compliance (door actuators, wheelchair lifts)
still_required_when: Awning with fixed vertical posts in public right-of-way (canopies)

discussion_rules.action: No plan permit for kitchen/bathroom remodel need not route to SFFD. Plan Reviewer N/As SFFD block.
discussion_rules.exception: Route to SFFD when cost exceeds $99,000 in Group R2 occupancy (see Attachment 2)

discussion_rules.text: Alternate water systems (greywater, reclaimed water, storm water detention)
discussion_rules.action: Route to PID (Plumbing Inspection Division) for review at site permit

discussion_rules.condition: Building permits involving Group R2 with cost of construction of $99,000 or more
New construction, horizontal/vertical addition, or alteration for multi-residential building increasing unit count by 10+
discussion_rules.action: Add CON-BOND to routing. Issuance held until Controller's office clearance.
discussion_rules.note: First Construction Document means first addendum authorizing construction (not demo, grading, shoring, site prep)

routing_matrix.scope_of_work: Re-roofing (No removal of wood shingle, No re- sheathing, No plywood replacement)
routing_matrix.comments: # Required if they are historic buildings (Category A). // Required for projects within the OCII areas, route to OCII instead of Planning * Roofing involving Hot Work (torch down or acetylene) SFFD required ^If requested no street space, then route to Public Works

routing_matrix.scope_of_work: Voluntary installation of anchor bolts and plywood sheathing at the first story of residential wood-frame buildings

routing_matrix.comments: # Required if the window is visible from street ^ MECH only. Required for residential buildings with 4 or more habitable stories and non-residential buildings * Required for any SFFD regulated occupancy (High - rise, A, E, H, I, L or R except for R-3) + Required for non-fixed windows in retail food and/or beverage facility // Required for projects within the OCII areas, route to OCII instead of Planning
Route to Planning for any scope of work on AAU properties which have active Planning code violation noted in Planning Information Map (PIM)

routing_matrix.scope_of_work: Soil disturbance of at least 50 cubic yards of soil within the Maher Area.
routing_matrix.comments: Refer applicant to complete Attachment 3 Examples of soil disturbance include grading, excavating, trenching, cut/fill, landscaping, planting, digging, burying, removing topsoil, etc. Refer to Information Sheet G-14 // Required for projects within the OCII areas, route to OCII instead of Planning

routing_matrix.scope_of_work: Soil disturbance of any volume within the Health Code Article 31 Area.
routing_matrix.comments: Refer applicant to complete Attachment 3 Sites within the Health Code Article 31 Area will note “Health Code Article 31 Restrictions Apply” under zoning information in a PIM property search. (Examples of soil disturbance include grading, excavating, trenching, cut/fill, landscaping, planting, digging, burying, removing topsoil, etc.https://sfdbi.org/sites/default/files/ IS G-14.pdf) // Required for projects within the OCII areas, route to OCII instead of Planning

routing_matrix.scope_of_work: Legalization of items listed on the Physical Inspection Report which generally requires plans
routing_matrix.comments: ^ MECH only. Required for new habitable space * Required for any SFFD regulated occupancy (High - rise, A, E, H, I, L or R except for R-3) Ø Required if includes addition of plumbing fixtures // Required for projects within the OCII areas, route to OCII instead of Planning
// Required for projects within the OCII areas, route to OCII instead of Planning
Ø Required for review of heavy water use and possible contaminated discharge. // Required for projects within the OCII areas, route to OCII instead of Planning

routing_matrix.scope_of_work: Project NOT on City- owned or leased property, and it does NOT receive public funding
routing_matrix.comments: * Required for any SFFD regulated occupancy (High - rise, A, E, H, I, L or R except for R-3) Ø Required for projects that include the addition of plumbing fixtures // Required for projects within the OCII areas, route to OCII instead of Planning

routing_matrix.scope_of_work: Project NOT on City- owned or leased property, but it receives public funding
routing_matrix.comments: * Required for any SFFD regulated occupancy (High - rise, A, E, H, I, L or R except for R-3) Ø Required for projects that include the addition of plumbing fixtures // Required for projects within the OCII areas, route to OCII instead of Planning

routing_matrix.scope_of_work: Project ON City-owned or leased property, and it is being managed, designed or built by DPW
routing_matrix.comments: * Required for any SFFD regulated occupancy (High - rise, A, E, H, I, L or R except for R-3) Ø Required for projects that include the addition of plumbing fixtures // Required for projects within the OCII areas, route to OCII instead of Planning + PW-DAC requires review for Disabled Access code compliance

routing_matrix.scope_of_work: Project ON city owned or leased property, and it is NOT being managed, designed or built by DPW
routing_matrix.comments: * Required for any SFFD regulated occupancy (High - rise, A, E, H, I, L or R except for R-3) Ø Required for projects that include the addition of plumbing fixtures // Required for projects within the OCII areas, route to OCII instead of Planning

routing_matrix.scope_of_work: Request of full compliance with Physical Inspection Report which generally does not require plans.
routing_matrix.comments: * Required for any SFFD regulated occupancy (High - rise, A, E, H, I, L or R except for R-3)
